title: Higher-order Constituent Parsing and Parser Combination
abstract: This paper presents a higher-order model for constituent parsing aimed at utilizing more local structural context to decide the score of a grammar rule instance in a parse tree. Experiments on English and Chinese treebanks confirm its advantage over its first-order version. It achieves its best F1 scores of 91.86% and 85.58% on the two languages, respectively, and further pushes them to 92.80% and 85.60% via combination with other high-performance parsers.
venue: Proceedings of the 50th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 2: Short Papers)

artifact_method: This paper presents a higher-order model for constituent parsing aimed at utilizing more local structural context to decide the score of a grammar rule instance in a parse tree.
